page.title: 13RECREATION - Village Hall
page.content: Brockenhurst Village Hall stands on part of the site of the old County High School and replaces the demolished Morant Hall in Lyndhurst Road. It was opened on the 11th September 1982, having been funded through various sponsorships and grants from various concils. There are three main rooms- the Forest Room, Beech Room and Oak Room - and there is also a well equipped kitchen. The variety of sports equipment and the stage are attractive facilities for the sporting and social occasions. The hall caters for all ages from Play School to Womens Institute. Activities include badminton, indoor bowls, gymnastics, youth club, brownies and the British Legion. There are regular dances and 'discos' for both age groups - old and young.
